snippet: Authorities are struggling to decide how to handle rolezinhos — rowdy gatherings of young people at shopping malls — as questions abound about the racial, social and class implications.
abstract: Sao Paulo Journal; authorities in Brazil are weighing their response to gatherings called rolezinhos, in which teenagers from gritty urban areas like Sao Paulo gather en masse at shopping malls; gatherings, which have alarmed middle class citizens, touch on issues of public space and entitlement in society where economic classes are in flux.

byline.contributor: Paula Ramón contributed reporting from São Paulo, and Taylor Barnes from Rio de Janeiro.

lead_paragraph: Authorities are struggling to decide how to handle rolezinhos — rowdy gatherings of young people at shopping malls — as questions abound about the racial, social and class implications.

headline.main: Brazil’s Latest Clash With Its Urban Youth Takes Place at the Mall
headline.print_headline: Brazil’s Latest Clash With Its Urban Youth Takes Place at the Mall
